title: Quiz 1 - Compound Interest
instruction: Given below are two quantities named I & II. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relation between the two quantities.

quiz.text: A man borrows Rs. 20,000 at 10% interest rate compounded annually. At the end of every year, he pays Rs. 2000 as part of repayment. How much does he still owe after three such installments?
options: 18500
20,000
17500
19000
None of these

quiz.text: A sum is invested for 3 years at certain CI rate annually. After 3 years, the amount earned by him is 119.7% more. What is the rate of interest?
options: 27%
30%
24%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: A sum is invested for four years at a certain rate of interest compounded annually. After 4 years, the amount increases by 107.36%. What is the rate of interest?
options: 10%
12%
15%
16%
20%

quiz.text: The compound interest on a certain sum for 2 years is Rs. 756 and Simple interest is Rs. 720. If the sum is invested such that the SI is Rs. 900 and the number of years is equal to the rate percent per annum, find the rate percent?
options: 10%
12%
5%
15%
None of these

quiz.text: At what percent of Rate of interest compounded annually does a Sum of Money becomes Nine fold in 2 years?
options: 200%
150%
100%
300%
None of these

quiz.text: Divide Rs. 12615 between P and Q so that P’s share at the end of 6 years may equal to Q’s share at the end of 8 years, interest being 5% compounded annually. Find Q’s share.
options: Rs. 6000
Rs. 5000
Rs. 6500
Rs. 5500
Rs 3500

quiz.text: Anjali invested an amount of Rs. 5800 for 2 years. At what rate of Compound Interest will she get an amount of Rs. 594.50 at the end of two years?
options: 5%
8%
7%
9%
10%

quiz.text: Arun and Gaurav have to clear their respective loans by paying 3 equal annual installments of Rs. 30,000 each. Arun pays an interest of 10% per annum of simple interest while Gaurav pays 10% per annum compound interest. What is the difference in their payments?
options: Rs. 400
Rs. 350
Rs. 300
Rs. 450
Rs. 500

quiz.text: Anjali borrowed Rs. 62,500 from Bank to purchase one home theatre system. If the rate of interest was 12% per annum compounded annually. What payment she ‘ll have to make after 2 years 3 months?
options: Rs. 80752
Rs. 88852
Rs. 80852
Rs. 80052
None of these

quiz.text: Anjali took a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase a TV set from LG. She promised to make the payment after three years. The company charges CI at 10% per annum for the same. But, suddenly the company announces the rate of interest as 15% per annum for the last one year of the loan period. What extra amount she has to pay due to the announcement of new rate of interest?
options: Rs. 1210
Rs. 1310
Rs. 1220
Rs. 1320
None of these

quiz.text: Anjali borrowed Rs. 20,000 from her friend at 18% per annum simple rate of interest. She lent it to Mohit at same rate of interest , but it is compounded annually now. Find her gain after 2 years.
options: Rs. 600
Rs. 688
Rs. 628
Rs 648
None of these

quiz.text: A tree’s height increases annually by 1/8th of its height. By how much will it’s height increase after 2.5 years, if it stands today at 10 m height?
options: 3.2 m
3.44 m
3.6 m
3.88 m
None of these

quiz.text: The difference between SI and CI on a certain sum for 3 years at 10% per annum is Rs. 15.50. What will be its sum?
options: Rs. 500
Rs. 600
Rs. 800
Rs. 700
None of these

quiz.text: If compound interest on a certain sum for two years at 10% per annum is Rs 2100 then what will be SI on same sum at same rate for 2 years?
options: Rs. 2500
Rs. 4400
Rs. 2000
Rs. 2200
None of these

quiz.text: If Rs. 12,000 amounts to Rs. 13230 in 2 years at CI. What will be the amount for Rs. 16000 in 3 years at same rate of interest compounded annually?
options: 17642
18000
18522
17522
None of these

quiz.text: At what time will a man receive Rs. 850 as Compound Interest on Rs. 3200 at 12.5% per annum compounded yearly?
options: 3 years
2 years
2.5 years
1 year
4 years

quiz.text: A sum of money was invested for 14 years in scheme A which offers simple interest at 8% per annum.  The amount received from Scheme A after 14 years was then invested for two years in Scheme B which offers CI at 10% per annum. If the interest received from Scheme B was Rs. 6678, then what was the sum invested in Scheme A?
options: Rs. 8000
Rs. 10000
Rs. 12500
Rs. 15000
None of these

quiz.text: At what rate of interest rate compounded annually will a sum of money become 8 times in 3 years?
options: 75%
50%
125%
100%
None of these

quiz.text: CI on a certain sum for 2 years is Rs. 40.80 and SI  is Rs. 40 for same year. What will be the rate of interest?
options: 2%
5%
4%
8%
None of these

quiz.text: An amount of money grows to Rs. 4840 in 2 years and to Rs. 5324 in 3 years on CI. Find rate of interest.
options: 5%
6%
8%
12%
10%

quiz.text: Rs. 4800 becomes Rs. 6000 in 4 years at compound rate of interest. What will be the sum after 12 years?
options: Rs. 9375
Rs 8000
Rs. 9261
Rs. 9000
None of these

quiz.text: A man borrows Rs. 3000 at rate of 10% compounded annually. At the end of each year, he pays back Rs. 1000. How much amount should he pay at the end of the 3rd year to clear all his dues?
options: Rs. 1583
Rs. 1789
Rs. 1600
Rs. 1683
None of these

quiz.text: A  deposits Rs. 20,000 in a private company at the rate of 16% compounded annually whereas B deposits an equal Sum in PNB at the rate of 15% per annum compounded half-yearly. If both deposit their money for 1 years only, then the interest A will earn is how much percent more or less than the interest earn by B?
options: 4.33%
6.45%
3.33%
7.33%
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of money is lent out at 20% per annum for 2 years. It would fetch Rs. 482 more if interest is compounded half-yearly. Find the sum.
options: Rs. 10,000
Rs. 20,000
Rs. 15,000
Rs. 25,000
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of amount at r% compound interest doubles in 3 years. In 9 years it will be k times of the original principle. What is the value of k?
options: 5 times
8 times
9 times
10 times
6.6 times

quiz.text: If the rate of interest is 10% per annum and Rs. 12000 lent at the compound interest half yearly. What is the equivalent simple rate of interest for first year?
options: 8%
10%
10.25%
8.25%
12%

quiz.text: The present worth of Dhiru’s Bill due 7 months hence, is Rs. 120000. If the bill were due at the end of two and half years its present worth would be Rs. 101600. Find the rate percent of the bill.
options: 10%
5%
12%
8%
None of these

quiz.text: Anu owes Biresh Rs 1120 payable 2 years hence, Biresh owes Anu 1081.50 payable 6 months. If they decide to settle their accounts forth while by payment of ready money and the rate of interest  be 6% per annum, then who should pay and how much?
options: Rs 100
Rs. 80
Rs. 75
Rs. 50
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of money is accumulating at compound interest at a certain rate of interest. If simple rate instead of compound interest were reckoned, the interest for the first two years would be diminished by Rs. 20 and that for the first three years, by Rs. 61. What is the sum?
options: Rs. 5500
Rs. 6500
Rs. 8000
Rs. 9000
Rs. 7500

quiz.text: A person invested a certain amount at simple interest at the rate of 6% per annum earning Rs. 9000 as an interest at the end of three years. Had the interest been compounded every year, how much more interest would he have earned on the same amount with the same interest rate after three years?
options: Rs. 550.80
Rs. 450.80
Rs. 368.60
Rs. 230
None of these

quiz.text: Mishra ji borrowed a certain sum from Tiwari ji at a certain rate of simple interest for 2 years. He lent this sum to Sharma ji at the same rate of interest compounded annually for the same period. At the end of two years, he received Rs. 4200 as Compound interest  but paid Rs. 4000 only as simple interest. Find the rate of interest.
options: 10%
12%
5%
20%
4%

quiz.text: Anu borrowed a sum of money and returned it in three equal quarterly installments of Rs. 17,576 each. Find the sum borrowed, if the rate of interest charged was 16% per annum  compounded quarterly.
options: Rs. 47775
Rs. 48775
Rs. 49285
Rs. 49950
None of these

quiz.text: Siddhartha has deposited certain amount in the bank to earn compound interest at 10% per annum. The difference between the interest of third year and second year on the amount  is Rs. 1,100. What amount has Siddhartha deposited?
options: Rs. 8500
Rs. 10,000
Rs. 9500
Rs. 11,000
Rs. 12,000

quiz.text: Find the principle if compound interest is charged on the principle at the rate of 16 per annum for two years and the sum becomes Rs. 196.
options: Rs. 154
Rs. 150
Rs. 144
Rs. 160
Rs. 134

quiz.text: Under PMAY, the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) allotted a house to Kamal Raj for Rs. 126100. This payment is to be made in three equal annual installments. If the money is reckoned at 5% per annum compound interest, then how much is to be paid by Kamal Raj in each installment?
options: Rs. 45405
Rs. 44505
Rs. 46305
Rs. 40,000
None of these

quiz.text: Scheme M offers simple interest at a certain rate of internet (per cent per annum). If the difference between the interest earned by Gaurav and Rishabh from scheme M after 4 yr in Rs. 4435.20, what is the rate of interest (per cent per annum)?
options: 17.5
18
16.5
20
15

quiz.text: What is the respective ratio between total amount invested by Gaurav in schemes O and Q together and total amount invested by Rishabh in the same scheme together?
options: 31 : 44
31 : 42
27 : 44
35 : 48
29 : 38

quiz.text: If scheme O offers compound interest (compounded annually) at 12% per annum, then what is the difference between interest earned by Gaurav and Rishabh from scheme O after 2 yr?
options: Rs. 1628.16
Rs. 1584.38
Rs. 1672.74
Rs. 1536.58
Rs. 1722.96

quiz.text: Rishabh invested in scheme R for 4 yr. If scheme R offers simple interest at 7% per annum for the first two years and then compound interest at 10% per annum (compound annually) for the 3rd and 4th year, then what will be the interest earned by Rishabh after 4 yr?
options: Rs. 13548.64
Rs. 13112.064
Rs. 12242.5
Rs. 12364
Rs. 11886

quiz.text: Amount invested by Gaurav in scheme S is equal to the amount invested by him in scheme N. The rate of interest per annum of schemes S and N are same. The only difference is scheme S offers compound interest (compounded annually), whereas the scheme N offers simple interest. If the difference between the interest earned by Gaurav from both the schemes after 2 yr is Rs. 349.92, then what is the rate of interest?
options: 9%
5%
13%
11%
7%

quiz.text: If two persons borrows an equal amount of Rs. 12000 under plan B and plan E respectively and rate of interest for the first year under plan B and D is same, then what is the difference between second year’s interests alone paid by each of them?
options: Rs.105.25
Rs.110.25
Rs.115.25
Rs.120.25
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: A person borrows Rs.20480 under plan C. After completion of the loan tenure of three years under plan C, he extends the tenure for further two years under plan D on the amount payable at that time. He settles his loan by paying Rs. 27778. What is the rate of interest for the second year under plan D if rate of interest for the third year under plan C and D is same?
options: %
%
%
%
%

quiz.text: If the amounts borrowed by a person under plan B and C are in the ratio 16 : 13 and rate of interest applicable during the first year under plan B and D is same, then what is ratio of interests payable under these plans at the end of second year.
options: 5 : 6
3 : 5
3 : 4
5 : 4
None of these

quiz.text: The lender decides to offer a fixed rate of interest at % per year under plan C. By how much percent the interest payable will increase from the interest payable previously under the old plan for the period of three years if rate of interest for the third year under old plan C and plan D is same?
options: %
%
%
%
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: Rates of interest for the first year under plan A and E are % and % respectively. A person borrows a total of Rs.30000 partially under plan A and E and pays a total interest of Rs.5540 at the end of third year. How much amount does he borrow under plan A?
options: Rs.14000
Rs.18000
Rs.16000
Rs.12000
Rs.20000

quiz.text: The value of a fixed asset depreciates at the rate of 10% on the value at the beginning of each year. If the value of the asset, two years ago, was Rs. 12,000  more than the value of the asset one year ago, then find the present value of the asset, given that the asset was bought two years ago?
options: Rs. 96,000
Rs. 97,000
Rs. 97,200
Rs. 90,000
None of these

quiz.text: Find the approximate amount of Rs. 8000 in one and a half years at 5% per annum compound interest payable half yearly?
options: Rs. 8715
Rs. 8885
Rs. 8000
Rs 8615
None of these

quiz.text: What will be the compound interest on Rs. 4000 at 24% per annum for 3 months, compounded monthly?
options: Rs. 244.83
Rs. 249.83
Rs. 280
Rs. 224.86
None of these

quiz.text:
Shudhir invested Rs. 16000 in a scheme which earned him simple interest at 15% per annum. After two years he withdrew the principal amount plus interest and invested the entire amount in another scheme for two years, which earned him compound interest at 12% per annum.

Quantity I  total interest earned by Sudhir at the end of 4 years

 

Sumit lent some money to Mohit at 5% per annum simple interest. Mohit lent the entire amount to Birju on the same day at  per annum. In this transaction after a year Mohit earned a profit of Rs. 350. Find the  

Quantity II sum of money lent by Sumit to Mohit.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I — the sum of money for which the difference between SI and CI obtained on it in 2 years at 6% per annum compounded annually is Rs. 43.2.

Quantity II — Rs. 12850
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
